description: push +â€Ž over; US 1906 of things, 1926 of people (bad boxers and easy women), popularized by Jack Conway of Variety.

entries.meaning: Someone who is easily swayed or influenced to change his/her mind or comply.
examples: I'm a pushover when it comes to buying new kitchen gadgets.

entries.meaning: Someone who lets him/herself be picked or bullied on without defending or standing up for him/herself.
Something that is easy to do or accomplish; an easy task.
